View SQL query of a report/segment
Allow to skip empty time periods
Display SQL in Reports and Segments
Displays SQL query of a report or segment on its view page
The account that a business customer is assigned to.
The billing address configured for the business customer.
The contact that is specified for the business customer.
The channel via which information about the business customer is received.
The number of employees of the business customer.
Customer identity that represents customers involved in business-to-business activities.
The leads that a business customer is assigned to.
The lifetime sales value associated with the business customer.
The name of the business customer.
The opportunities that a business customer is assigned to.
The type of legal ownership of the business customer.
The rating of the business customer.
The shipping address configured for the business customer.
The ticker symbol of the business customer.
The address of the business customer's website.
Customer Account must not be empty.
Association with multiple Customers is not allowed.
Customer does not match the Account.
This widget displays forecast of opportunities
This widget displays the list of leads that can be configured to show only leads in certain conditions, e.g. only open leads that are owned by the current user.
This widget gives you a quick overview of a B2B workflow in form of a funnel chart.
Choose which data to display on the chart: Count shows the number of opportunities with a particular lead source, and Amount displays their total budget.
This widget displays a breakdown of opportunities by Lead source in form of a pie chart.
Choose Lead sources that will merge into Others group
This widget displays a breakdown of opportunities by status in form of a bar chart.
Choose which data to display on the chart: Count shows the number of opportunities in a particular status, and Amount displays their total budget.
This widget displays the list of opportunities that can be configured to show only opportunities in certain conditions, e.g. only open opportunities that are owned by the current user.

Choose customer account the Opportunity will be related to. Account name is displayed in parentheses if it differs from the customer name. To create a new customer account, type their name into the control and choose option marked as New.
Collection of lead addresses: mailing, business, home, billing, etc.
Name of the company or organization the lead represents or belongs to.
A contact the lead was converted into.
Unable to convert lead to opportunity
A customer or an account the lead is created for.
Sales channel within OroCRM to which the lead belongs. **(Will be removed in 2.0;)**

Leads are prospects or potential sales in a form of contact data. Lead records represent commercial activity with people or businesses that have authority, budget and interest to purchase goods and/or services.
First name of the lead person.
Industry where the lead's company is operating.
Job title of the lead person within the company.
Last name of the lead person.
